answers.answer: There is no meaningful difference between the EF of 21 and 25% both numbers represent a severe impairment of the heart's pumping ability. It could just be that your diabetes is getting worse. Carvedilol should be taken with caution in diabetics because it can mask the symptoms of a low blood sugar, not a concern for you since you are not on diabetes medications that could lower your sugar in the first place.

I asked earlier about my diabetes effecting my heart.  I have had it under control for about 1.5 years with just a diet but it has started going up with the meds I have been taking. Could my diabetes effect my EF rating?  I could walk 4 miles a day before I got on carevdilol. Now I can hardly make it around the block. My doctor told me that it is his expeirence that a patient will git feel worse before he gits better.

Uncontrolled diabetes can affect the heart after several years, but this is not the case with you. It is not affecting your EF. The carvedilol could be making you feel worse; this is usually, but not always a temporary condition. Alternatively, your underlying cardiomyopathy may be getting worse.

COULD A COLD OR CHEST CONGESTION ALTER YOUR EF FACTOR?CAN THE EF FACTOR VERY BETWEEN MUGA, CATHERIZATION, ECO.MY EF RATINGS HAVED VERIED ALL THREE TEST.I HAVE NEVER BEEN TESTED BY ANY OF THE THREE MORE THAN ONCE.COULD THAT BE THE REASON THAT MY MUGA TEST WAS 28%.CATHERIZATION 25%SEVEN MONTHS LATER 21% WITH ECHO.WHICH IS THE MORE ACCURATE?I HAVE ASKED ABOUT A DURG REACTION PLEASE TELL ME IF THAT IS POSSIBLE.  IT JUST DOES NOT SOUND RIGHT IF SOMETHING IS NOT WORKING TO JUST KEEP TAKING IT AND ADDING AN OTHER DRUG. THEN IF THAT DOES NOT WORK LETS ADD ANOTHER. COULD YOU PLEASE GO OVER THEM?I UNDERSTAND FROM THE MANUFACTURE OF LISIPROL COULD HAVE A SIDE EFFECT OF DIABETES.IM QUITE CONCERNED WITH MY CONDITION WOULD YOU SUGGEST ANOTHER OPINION.SHOULD I BE THINKING OF THE ULTIMATE OUT COME OF US ALL, BEING CLOSER AND REVERSABLE?I FEEL THAT MY DOCTORS ARE TRYING TO KEEP MY SPIRITS UP, WHICH I UNDERSTAND IS NECESARY TO STOP STRESS.  BUT THIS COULD ALSO CAUSE NOT KNOWING AND MORE STRESS.NORVASC COULD HAVE A SIDE EFFECT OF DIABETES?IM AM NOT SAYING THAT THESE DRUGS HAVE CAUSED MY DIABETES, BUT I FEEL THAT THEY COULD HAVE WORSEN THE CONDITION.THANK YOU

A cold would not lower your EF. All three tests are slightly different and can produce different EFs. However, the correct interpretation of the three tests is that your EF is low; 21, 25, and 28% are all in the same ballpark and are really the same number. I think your doctors have you on good doses of good medicines. I do not think that the medicines are causing your heart any problems, but in fact are probably keeping it from deteriorating further. Again, i do not believe your medicines are causing diabetes. Lisinopril is actually a good medicine for diabetics.
Hi!I have had my heart checked again now my EF is 40% does that mean my cardiomyopathy is getting better since my EF factor is going up.

question: Hi.In May of 1999 I was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy with a EF rating of 25% by catherization.  In Dec of 1999, by echocardiogram my EF rating was 21%. Would it be fair to assume that although the EF ratings are different that my condition has not worsened since these are different tests?I am also a diabetic.  I have controlled my sugar with a diet for about a year and six months.  Now after starting Carvedilol for my heart I have noticed that my sugar increasingly higher.  Could there be a conection between the two?  I have read that precaution should be taken with people with diabetes.Is it possible that the combination of any medication listed below is causing interaction?Cavedilol 12.5 mg twice a day, Spironalactone 25mg per day, Amlodipine Besylate 5mg per day, Lisinopril 40 mg per day, one baby aspirin, Furosemide 4 mg per day, Cigoxin .25mg per day.Could a ajustment be made to help my problem of both Cadiomyopathy and Diabetes.
title: Drug interaction
